newsitem.title: CANADA: Barrick says only one obstacle to Busang.
newsitem.headline: Barrick says only one obstacle to Busang.

text.p: A letter from the Indonesian government says the only obstacle to a joint venture between Bre-X Minerals Ltd and Barrick Gold Corp is agreements with two of Bre-X's Indonesian partners, Barrick says.
"The one matter to be worked out is to ensure Bre-X's Indonesian partners are secure," Barrick spokesman Vince Borg said in an interview.

The government letter recognizes only PT Askatindo Karya Mineral and PT Amsya Linya as legal partners on the richest parts of Busang, Borg said. He said Indonesian businessman Jusuf Merukh was not recognized.
Merukh has launched a C$2 billion lawsuit against Bre-X in Canada, claiming up to 40 percent of the deposit.
The Indonesian government's offer to help Barrick, Bre-X and Bre-X's local partners reach an agreement is encouraging, Borg said.
"This is a very significant step forward," he said.
Borg said he was "confident" a final agreement could be reached in time to meet the Indonesian government's one-month deadline.
And he did not place much weight in another deal proposed by Vancouver-based Placer Dome Inc.
"I don't see how the Placer proposal can at all effect the progress we'll be making in reaching a final agreement," Borg said.
"The main thing here is that the government has reaffirmed its support of Barrick's participation."
Last week, Placer Dome publicly proposed a merger of Placer and Bre-X to develop Busang, with a 40 percent slice of the deposit going to Indonesian interests.
